intro: Piper phuwuaense, commonly known as the Phu Wuwa pepper, is a flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, elongated berry that turns red when mature.
